channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hungary says it will quit the International Criminal Court as Netanyahu visits
item.description: Hungary said it will start the process to withdraw from the International Criminal Court, just as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who faces...

item.title: More homes are finally hitting the spring market. Will buyers take the plunge?
item.description: After a couple extremely slow years, more inventory is finally hitting the market this spring. But buyers might be put off by high prices and an unste...

item.title: Dow drops 1,500 points on trade war fears over new tariffs
item.description: President Trump announced sweeping tariffs on imported goods, which were higher and broader than many expected. The new import taxes are expected to r...

item.title: We tried out the Nintendo Switch 2 â€” it's a solid console sequel
item.description: We played hours of Nintendo Switch 2 games the same day President Trump announced new global tariffs. Despite the hefty price tag, it's a solid evolut...

item.title: RFK Jr. wants to stop people using SNAP benefits to buy soda. Will it help?
item.description: Nutritionists agree reducing the amount of sugar people consume would be good for the Nation's health. But the plan to block people from using food as...

item.title: UK set to host 2035 Women's World Cup
item.description: The home nations England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland will likely be hosting the 2035 Women's World Cup as the only 'valid' bid.

item.title: Russia not on Trump's tariff list
item.description: US media quotes the White House press secretary as saying this is because of sanctions on Moscow.

item.title: Violent storms cut through the South and Midwest, spawning tornadoes and killing 3
item.description: Violent storms and tornadoes tore through cities from Oklahoma to Indiana during what could be a record-setting period of deadly weather and flooding.

item.title: A historic Black church took the Proud Boys to court. Now it controls their trademark
Severe storms in South and Midwest turn deadly
item.description: Violent storms cut through a wide swath of the South and Midwest, spawning tornadoes and killing at least two people, knocking down power lines and tr...

item.title: Hungary withdraws from International Criminal Court during Netanyahu visit
item.description: The move is announced hours after Israel's PM, who is sought under an ICC arrest warrant, arrives in Budapest for a state visit.

item.title: Which products will be affected by new tariffs announced by Trump?
item.description: President Trump rolled out new tariffs on April 2 aimed at easing trade imbalances. Here's which products could become more expensive as a result.

item.title: iPhones, prices and Brexit: Your questions about tariffs answered
item.description: Donald Trump slaps much of the world with a 10% baseline tariff while others face even higher rates. Our correspondents answer your questions.

item.title: Rare life-sized statues of toga-clad couple found in Pompeii tomb
item.description: The couple may have been married, and the woman appears to have been a priestess, researchers said.

item.title: Is South Africa's coalition government about to fall apart?
item.description: The pro-business DA rejects the budget leaving the ANC to rely on other parties to get it passed in parliament.

item.title: Dow plunges more than 1,400 points as stocks react to tariff shock
item.description: The Dow opened sharply lower as investors fret over the potential economic impact of President Trump's latest tariffs.

item.title: 2025 Atlantic hurricane season will be above average, researchers predict
item.description: A new forecast from researchers at Colorado State University predicts the 2025 hurricane season will be busier than an average year.

item.title: This is what forecasters mean when they talk about a 100-year flood
